alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 4:05AM PST until March 02 at 5:39PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. .Periods of moderate rain will continue through the morning hours today before tapering to scattered showers by the afternoon. Most of the hydrologically significant rainfall is coming to an end this morning, however, area rivers will likely to continue to rise in response to persistent rainfall over the last 24 to 36 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River At Randle. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause major flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...with dangerous inundation of many roads including US Highway 12...residential and commercial areas...and farms. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters... tributaries...and other streams within and near the Cowlitz River Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1215 PM PST.
